data.title: The King's Court
data.meta_description: Take a look at some of the incredible words well-known people have said about Kevin's Slaten's radio show. We appreciate their feedback as it helps us better understand our audience.
data.text:
"Kevin and I have done a number of interviews over the years. He is always prepared with tough questions, and I know I need to be on my toes. If you try to BS around an answer he will eat your lunch."

President of St. Louis Cardinals Baseball Club

"When I first heard Kevin "The King" Slaten I could not stop listening! He is passionate, knowledgeable, creative and will never back down from asking the question that needs to be asked or discussing the topics that need to be discussed.

More than anything, he may not even remember, but the first live radio show I did in St. Louis was with Kevin. I was a young college kid with aspirations and he treated me with respect and kindness."

Fox 2 News, Main Anchor

"I have been a loyal follower of "The King," Kevin Slaten, for well over 20 years, including television and radio. Over the last few years, I have gotten to be personal friends with him. Kevin has ALWAYS been one who tells the TRUTH and can back up his comments and beliefs with FACTS. My wife and I can also attest to the fact that his sponsors are great. Because of Kevin's recommendation, we replaced all of our windows in our house with Window World windows. Our utility bills have definitely lowered significantly.

I must also say, and my wife Nancy will confirm, I cannot go a DAY without listening to Kevin's show in the morning. It's the ONLY place we get our news. He's honest and reliable. FACTS, baby, FACTS!"

Major Richard Wagner

“Kevin Slaten, one of the top thought leaders in radio today. Quick, clever, challenging, knowledgeable and always entertaining, Kevin is a must listen daily!!”

Mizzou basketball All American, 4 time Big 8 champion, member of U.S. National team, winning a silver medal, 1st round NBA draft pick where he played 9 seasons, broadcaster for ESPN and CBS, founder of Sundvold Capital Management

"For more than twenty-five years, Kevin Slaten and I have been friends. We even shared a hotel room during a snowstorm in Iowa City during a Big Ten Basketball game. Now, Kevin claims that I snored, but I promise he was much louder!!!!!Kevin is a true professional, well-versed in various subject matters, and unafraid to stand up for what is right.I continue to marvel at Kevin’s ability to use his media platform to challenge his listeners to think beyond their comfort zone. I want to wish Kevin the best."

Ed worked 12 Final Fours, the World Championship of basketball, the European basketball championship, the Goodwill Games as basketball referee. Named College basketball referee of the Year and is a member of the Illinois basketball coaches Hall of Fame. As an educator he was named Illinois Principal of the Year and later served as Superintendent of the Edwardsville high school district

“I’ve known Kevin for over 30 years. I’ve worked with him, hired him and have recommended him to other networks who have hired him. He is as versatile and multi-talented as you will find in a broadcaster. He can do it all!”

Oklahoma Athletic Director & VP of Intercollegiate Athletics Programs since 1998, Former Mizzou Athletic Director

“In this day and age it’s hard to find authentic, tell it like it is personalities that don’t worry who they piss off. Kevin has always been a maverick in that sense. He knows how to stir the pot when the pot needs stirring. Who doesn’t appreciate that!”

For over 30 years, Dan McHugh has been a noteworthy leader in the CPG beverage marketing industry. Dan's expansive marketing career includes running iconic global brands such as Budweiser, Bud Light, and Pabst Blue Ribbon.

During his tenure, McHugh was responsible for successfully negotiating major sponsorships with the MLB, NFL, NHL, NASCAR, NBA, UFC, World Cup, and Olympic competitions.

Well versed in developing portfolio strategies and overseeing all aspects of brand development to deliver bottom-line profitability and long-term growth. A solid reputation as a strategic decision maker with the ability to lead large scale marketing organizations.

Dan McHigh joined the Monster Energy Company in 2018 as Global Chief Marketing Officer. He is a graduate of the University of Evansville and currently resides in Carlsbad, CA.

"Over the years I have always enjoyed my conversations with Kevin. Whether private or public , they were thoughtful , perceptive and candid. His passion for sports is unmatched and is demonstrated by the energy and emotional commitment he brings to his show. He does it his way - unique , provocative and never boring."

Director of football operations, Los Angeles/St. Louis Rams

"I’ve had the good fortune of working with some of the best talent in broadcasting. Kevin is right up there with what he does. While I don’t always agree with his opinion, I respect his intelligence and his ability to force me to consider his viewpoint. In addition, he is one of the most loyal people you could have in your corner."

Former Vice President of Geographic Marketing and Special Events at Anheuser-Busch and Sr. VP of Marketing at Gander Mountain

"If you’re looking for podcasts without opinions? Keep looking!! Kevin will light it up and make you laugh or scream or squirm.. it’s up to you, but he’ll always make you think ..long live the King !!"

Long time radio broadcaster at KMOX and KTRS radio and co host of TV news talk show Donnybrook

"Kevin … Legend, Myth, Frank, Honest, Prepared, Smart and never afraid to call people out when they need or deserve it. He doesn’t mind if he makes you a little uncomfortable with his point of view, but it is always real, honest and backed with facts.

A good friend of mine for a long time. A guy you can always count on when you need help. We have been lucky to have him in St Louis for all these years. I would never call him politically correct and I am glad for that. I wish there were more Kevin Slaten’s out there.

He seldom backs down but he has always listened to what I have had to say. I hold the “King” in high regard. This is why we love him. What you see is what you get. No apologies. Hard to beat that."

Former President of Gander Mountain & Former Exec VP/COO of Anheuser Busch

“I’ve known the King for close to 20 years, and have always respected his take on things. He’s passionate, patriotic and forthright. In an age of Uber political correctness it’s refreshing to hear his side.”

Former EVP, Global Industry & Creative Development at Anheuser-Busch. Responsible for their award winning Super Bowl ads.

Kevin Slaten is a Friend in the true sense of the word. He’s honest, caring, sincere, and of the highest integrity. Kevin is very intelligent, a talented attorney, and one of the most knowledgeable broadcast personalities I have ever listened to. I really can’t understand why Kevin isn’t on a national network.

Kevin comes from a very strong Family background, and has very good Family values, which he shows with his words and actions. Kevin is a wonderful Father, raising his Son Troy by himself, and did so willingly and lovingly. Now Kevin is a proud and fully involved Grandfather.

Kevin Slaten is one of those rare Human Beings that you thank the Lord for ever day, because you were allowed to cross Kevin’s path.

Former Missouri State Representative

"My relationship with Kevin Slaten spans 2 decades and there is not a better interviewer with an honest knowledge of sports - all sports! I have been on Kevin’s show on a consistent basis and it ( on a personal level) is so entertaining and garners huge positive responses from my patients- many of which are ardent advocates"

Medical Director for U.S. Center for Sports Medicine. Member of St. Louis Sports Hall of Fame and Missouri Sports Hall of Fame. Team Doctor for U.S. Track and Field in four Olympic Games and 7 U.S. Track and Field World Championships. Part owner of Florida Panthers of the NHL as well as team doctor for the Panthers, Tampa Bay Lightening, and St. Louis Blues. Has served on the NHL Board of Governors and the St. Louis Sports Commission

“If there was a Mount Rushmore of sports casters from Saint Louis, Kevin Slaten would be up there. Don't know who the other 3 would be but definitely Kevin would be one. Started listening to Kevin when I moved to Saint Louis in 1998 and have never stopped. Now I love listening to him when it comes to politics. He’s every bit as knowledgeable about politics as he is about sports. A true legend.”

Owner of Chuck's Boots

"Kevin Slaten, and The King's Court, was the first inspiration for me to do talk radio. After working with Kevin for years, I'm now a top rated talk show host myself. Not a day goes by I don't think of Kevin's influence and the impact of the King's Court. Still a listener to this day."

Host of War Room
